intro: Satyria maguirei, commonly known as the Maguire's sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. The plant thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal or inland dune environments. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
